TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: Does anyone have a working link for the 0.0824 version? I tried donloading via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> but the download never ends

<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> says scatterer conflicts with Scatterer, it conflicts with itself, I can't install any mods with <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> now. How do I fix this?

**Edited <time datetime="2021-11-28T20:23:06Z" title="11/28/2021 08:23  PM" data-short="2 yr">November 28, 2021</time> by Hyperspace Industries**
  
Update: I've fixed it by deleting with CKAN and manually reinstalling scatterer.

This should fix the blue atmo on ships in orbit, just replace the shaders from latest version: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b3P27snp629reVFDgy_3El16LzACI0Il/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b3P27snp629reVFDgy_3El16LzACI0Il/view?usp=sharing)

> 
> On 11/28/2021 at 11:50 AM, Hyperspace Industries said:
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> says scatterer conflicts with Scatterer, it conflicts with itself, I can't install any mods with <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> now. How do I fix this?
> 

Ask in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> thread.

> 
> 
> On 11/26/2021 at 3:07 AM, Willer Kerman said:
> 
> 
> Does anyone have a working link for the 0.0824 version? I tried donloading via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> but the download never ends
> 

I removed 0.0824 for being buggy. Download 0.0825b and combine it with the fix above.

Hello

I've been playing scatterer for a while now, it's a great mod!

I'm playing on 1.11.2.

The scatterer version I use most often is the 0.0767 Pre-Release. 

However, once, I tried using 0.0722. This version's sunflare is a bit messed up, but makes TUFX and Engine Effects and Reentry effects look much better.

0.0767 Doesn't have the cool effects, but the sunflare works.

Does anyone know a version that has a working sunflare and cool effects, or a config that makes 0.0767 have cool effects, or a config that makes 0.0722's sunflare work?

Images

[https://imgur.com/a/DDCjvPJ](https://imgur.com/a/DDCjvPJ)

I also don't have the log right now, if you need it. I'm quite new to the forums. I hope this problem doesn't need it.

This is in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)"><abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr></abbr> with mods that may or may not affect this such as Reentry particle effects renewed, <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr>, scatterer (obviously), RSSVE, Engine Lighting Relit, TU, TUFX (I use Fox's Warm HDR Profile) and Waterfall, if that helps.

Thanks!

Sorry, I tried to figure out the answer first, and I know <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> would solve this specifically but no.  

Having the same JNSQ issue, atmospheres completely unlit/black for a number of bodies. The answer given to the other person asking was to update configs, but I'm not sure where I should be getting them separate from what's inside Scatterer and JNSQ already.

JNSQ hasn't updated its configs yet, so they don't technically exist. I believe the reason for the blackness is that JNSQ sets the variable cloudColorMultiplier to 0 for several planets.

I've made some configs for JNSQ that work with the latest version of scatterer if you're interested. They should be fairly similar to the default, but no promises.

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="210269" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed9538599297" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/184880-1121-jnsq-0100-23-sept-2021/&do=embed&comment=4062086&embedComment=4062086&embedDo=findComment" style="height:297px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

It's one of those mods I'm never 100% sure will need external configs, cause some mods seem to provide them (like JNSQ), or like, if I'll still need the stock planet configs or not.  

Sidenote:

Spoiler

I'd use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> but... no more. Tried it just now hoping the outdated JNSQ scatterer config issue would be solved that way, and I don't know if this is just happening for me, but <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> will not install JNSQ. It just gives me one error or another every time. So back to manual with your configs, thank you again!

See Blackrack's post a few days ago on this page.

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) Whenever you have time to look at this, I've noticed an issue with atmosphereless bodies in the latest release of Scatterer with TAA enabled: The bodies seem to "smear" as if the antialiasing doesn't realise the bodies or camera are moving around. This is cleared by other things, like the skybox or a vessel, as well as sometimes certain regions of the screen?

Images below:

Spoiler

![ZVnaNgA.png](https://i.imgur.com/ZVnaNgA.png)

![htdowHE.png](https://i.imgur.com/htdowHE.png)

![dNKmzkJ.png](https://i.imgur.com/dNKmzkJ.png)

The craft was spinning for all of these, to give a better idea of its effect on the images.

To reproduce, what I did was get a new install of KSP 1.12.2, install scatterer v0.0825b (and the blue crafts fix), start a sandbox game, go into the scatterer settings, set the preset to "high," then turn SMAA off and TAA on. Then I cheated a simple craft into low orbit of an airless body. I'm not sure the "high" preset is necessary, nor is cheating.

log is here, if it helps: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rN-kLg_vgcSh8n4inPy67kGwHUCPCWq-/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rN-kLg_vgcSh8n4inPy67kGwHUCPCWq-/view?usp=sharing)

I think it's enough to create an empty profile that only has a name and the AA method set. However, TAA doesn't work well with map view, but you can make a different profile for map view and tracking station without TAA.

**KSP:** 1.12.2 Windows 64-bit

**Problem:** Pixel values greater than 1 appear incorrect (black or some combination of saturated RGB values). Problem disappears when tonemapper selection is changed, even if changed back to the previous value.  

Spoiler

![t2PaOlV.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/t2PaOlV.jpg)

![y3w5nZx.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/y3w5nZx.jpg)

**Mods installed:**

Scatterer 0.0825b

**Reproduction steps:**

Use fresh install of Scatterer with default settings. Look at the sun glint on the water from the space center after sunrise, or look at spacecraft windows in sunlight with its lights turned on, etc. After tonemapper selection is changed and a scene change applies the change, the problem will never re-appear, even after changing back to default tonemapper and restarting the program.

**Log:**

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pEp69U2JjoXRQcoZE0fQiw3pis5AX1GW/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pEp69U2JjoXRQcoZE0fQiw3pis5AX1GW/view?usp=sharing)

Note: I can also reproduce this issue on my main PC (Windows 10, Ryzen 3700X, GTX 1080 Ti)

How can I make this work for <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>?

Just pushed the following fixes:

    - Fixed wrong scattering on ships near atmosphere edge (most noticeable as blue tint appearing on ships in orbit)
    - Fixed flickering sky in reflections (most noticeable on TU parts)
    - Fixed flickering clouds in reflections (most noticeable on TU parts)
    - Fixed mirror image on scaled planets with in-game AA set to off
    - Fix broken multi-star lighting on scaled planets with eclipses on

Checked <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> today and got some updates.  Mostly Scatterer and I think one <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>.  The update went normally and KSP runs ok.  The thing is that now the dark side of Kerbin is white.  Just wondering if this is a holidays theme.

There is currently a bug with the shader where the log spams missing "\_MainTex" whenever Jool is loaded. I have tracked it down to the latest update. To replicate just zoom into jool on the Tracking Station.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, SolarShield said:
> 
> 
> There is currently a bug with the shader where the log spams missing "\_MainTex" whenever Jool is loaded. I have tracked it down to the latest update. To replicate just zoom into jool on the Tracking Station.
> 

That actually makes sense why it happens... An edge case I haven't tested I guess. Although the log spam itself should be moderate (once every second or so and not a full on every frame spam)
